Instead of determining integers $j$ and $k$ such that the value of the interpolating polynomial at a point beyond the range of interpolation points equals the difference of two Fibonacci numbers, simply find $d = N - 1008$, where $N$ is the degree of the polynomial. Determine the smallest real number $r > d$ such that there exist differentiable functions $f\colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ and $g\colon \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ satisfying \begin{enumerate} \item[(a)] $f(d) > d$, \item[(b)] $g(d) = d$, \item[(c)] $|f'(x)| \leq |g(x)|$ for all $x$, \item[(d)] $|g'(x)| \leq |f(x)|$ for all $x$, and \item[(e)] $f(r) = d$. \end{enumerate}
